conclusion: To solve the problem, analyze forces on the conductor rod and apply magnetic force and torque principles.
Image shows a 3D Cartesian coordinate system with rod cd suspended horizontally by two strings, aligned with positive x-axis, magnetic induction directed along negative z-axis.
Conductor rod cd is suspended horizontally, net force is zero, gravitational force mg balanced by tension T in strings.
Magnetic force Fm on rod due to magnetic induction B1 is given by Fm = I1 L B1.
Magnetic force must counteract gravitational force for rod to remain stationary, so Fm = mg.
Equating magnetic force to gravitational force gives I1 L B1 = mg.
Solving for I1, we have I1 = mg / (L B1).
Substituting given values m = 10 g, g = 10 m/s^2, L = 50 cm = 0.5 m, B1 = 1.0 T, find I1 = 20 A.
Direction of current I1 determined by right-hand rule, fingers along positive x-axis, thumb along negative z-axis, current flows in thumb direction.
Magnitude of current is I1 = 20 A, direction of current is from c to d.
